intro: Campanopsis tuberosa, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue or purple, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in partial shade and well-drained soil, making it suitable for woodland gardens. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
